qas.question: What event cause shipping activities to be suspended?
Petrochemical refineries and manufacturing plants were built due to the demand for what items during the war?
When was the Brown Shipbuilding Company founded?
What was the policy created by President Roosevelt due to the boom in defense jobs?
What kind of refineries were built along the Houston ship channel?
To fill what type of demand were refineries built?
What world event caused this increased need for petrochemicals?
Why did thousands of new workers flock to Houston?
Which president created a policy of non-discrimination for defense contractors?
What event cause shipping activities to begin?
Farms were built due to the demand for what items during the war?
When was the Brown Shipbuilding Company destroyed?
hat was the policy created by the Vice-President due to the boom in defense jobs?

context: When <a0_0><a7_0><b10_0>World War II<b10_0/><a7_0/><a0_0/> started, tonnage levels at the port decreased and shipping activities were suspended; however, the war did provide economic benefits for the city. <a5_0>Petrochemical<a5_0/> refineries and manufacturing plants were constructed along the ship channel because of the demand for <a1_0><a6_0><b11_0>petroleum and synthetic rubber<b11_0/><a6_0/> products<a1_0/> by the defense industry during the war. Ellington Field, initially built <a2_0><b12_0>during World War I<b12_0/><a2_0/>, was revitalized as an advanced training center for bombardiers and navigators. The Brown Shipbuilding Company was founded in <a3_0><b13_0>1942<b13_0/><a3_0/> to build ships for the U.S. Navy during World War II. Due to the boom in <a8_0>defense jobs<a8_0/>, thousands of new workers migrated to the city, both blacks and whites competing for the higher-paying jobs. <a9_0>President Roosevelt<a9_0/> had established a policy of <a4_0><b14_0>non-discrimination for defense contractors<b14_0/><a4_0/>, and blacks gained some opportunities, especially in shipbuilding, although not without resistance from whites and increasing social tensions that erupted into occasional violence. Economic gains of blacks who entered defense industries continued in the postwar years.
